GeneralInformation.School Vision: Scholars of TomorrowScholars refers to Rulangnites who are equipped with the 21st Century Competencies; eventually grow to be people of integrity, imbued with a sense of community spirit, identity & responsibility as they take their places in our diverse society.Rulang envisions Tomorrow as a future that is full of uncertainties. Hence, Rulang aims to equip every Rulangnite with the skills and environment to develop resilience and adaptability which would help them thrive. Rulang also aims to inspire Rulangnites to meet future challenges while remaining rooted to the community and nation.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Nurturing Competencies, Inspiring Excellence, Empowering IndividualsIn leading Rulangnites to be the Scholars of Tomorrow, it is Rulang's mission to equip them with the desired 21st Century Competencies. In embracing globalization, Rulangnites will also be exposed to civic literacy, global awareness and cross cultural skills while provided with plenty of opportunities for them to hone their critical and inventive thinking. Rulang strives to inspire pupils in achieving excellence in the five domains namely cognitive, aesthetics, physical, social and moral domains. Rulang believes in empowering individuals as every child can be nurtured to his or her fullest potential.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school philosophy encapsulates our belief that given the right environment and support, all pupils can learn and achieve. Rulang aims to provide a holistic education that creates learning experiences to develop each pupil's intellectual capacities, character, aesthetics, sporting and leadership qualities through an enriched forward-looking learning environment beyond the classroom. Rulang is also committed in creating school experiences that are pupils centric and would equip pupils with the necessary knowledge, skills and values for living and working as active contributors in the 21st century. These areas include increasing resiliency in our students, use of ICT to deepen pedagogy and the promotion of an Aesthetics Culture to harness our pupils' creativity and curiosity.    The Rulang family is bonded by the culture of excellence, collegiality and teamwork. This culture and working ethics are based on the acronyms TRUE HEARTs where every staff is valued and every effort recognized and celebrated. The TRUE HEART culture spurs the staff towards quality staff work and school pride.   The TRUE HEARTs philosophy has also been cascaded to all Rulangnites. A Rulangnite is taught to never stop questioning, encouraged to blaze his own trail instead of accepting barriers, and to infuse the TRUE HEARTs culture and spirit into his everyday life. This will instill in Rulangnites the core leadership values of having integrity, being morally upright, and being a risk taker.   We believe that Rulangnites can achieve peaks of excellence by being the best that they can be in their chosen fields.  Upon completion of their primary education, they will each graduate as an accomplished learner, a loyal citizen, an effective leader and a cosmopolitan.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / DOUBLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Sports Teach Responsibility, Inventiveness, Values & Excellence (STRIVE) @ Rulang

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Rulang Primary School aims to provide a holistic education to develop all pupils into confident 21st Century learners and wholesome individuals.  Applied Learning Programme (ALP): Enhancing 21CC through Robotics challenges students to connect their existing schema and apply them to an authentic setting for acquisition of knowledge. Our Integrated Robotics Curriculum (IRC) lessons serve to bring about higher engagement in learning and cultivates teamwork through collaborative learning.   Learning for Life Programme (LLP): STRIVE @ Rulang (Sports Teach Responsibility, Inventiveness, Values & Excellence). This is a broad based programme for all students and is all-inclusive sporting and outdoor experience whilst providing opportunities for those with greater interest and/or talent to further develop their strengths and interests. We have a structured Physical Education programme that spans from P1 to P6 (modular system), Programme for Active Learning (PAL) which is targeted at P1 & P2 and a myriad of Co-Curricular Activities (CCAs) that are offered to the students at P3 to P6  through a skill, aptitude and interest based approach are aligned with 21CC. Our unique and structured Character Development Framework and Student Leadership Framework seek to develop pupils into wholesome individuals through five domains namely socialisation, citizenship, leadership, entrepreneurship and internationalisation. In imbuing identified values and outcomes, the framework has been integrated into instructional and non-instructional programmes while being explicitly taught in our customised school wide programmes namely Co-Curricular & Special Programmes (CCSP), GIFTS (Generating Interactions for Total Socialisation)   and Values-in-Practice Programme (VIP).
